@piloth@zeroid.bit: No idea. ZeroNet is not for real-time streaming by design, so I guess any radio station here will look more like a Youtube channel with frequent updates. So a visitor can listen latest news, search through archive, view the schedule etc.

Does KopyKate work at all?

It works okay from ipfs.io (I'm accessing it via Tor), although requires some time for ipfs.io to cache the data. I don't use the IPFS daemon on my local machine, since I don't trust IPFS and it reveals my IP address to other peers.

Nice songs!

By the way, my favorite song in Portuguese is ["CidadÃ£o"](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1uPLoaDwKzP6MCGoVzw48r4pxawRBdmQc/data/users/1GooUE19488nDwG3TdkM8seYAHct4gjkq4/1584362913-Z%C3%A9%20Ramalho%20-%20Cidad%C3%A3o.mp4).
Published the file to ZeroUp. Not so feature-rich as KopyKate, but least it seems to allow sharing files without dealing to weird bugs. Please tell me, if it loads and works okay or not. I'm behind Tor, so it may take some time...

> Not Found
:-(

> Why don't you trust ipfs?

It uses a Distrubuted Hash Table to save the IP addresses of all the peers (in the same way as BitTorrent's DHT does), and it doesn't support hiding the IP addresses behind Tor. So, anyone knowing that I seed "file A", "file B" and "file C" is able to look through DHT entries and get my real IP.
We have 3 grammatical genders here in Russian, so Ð½ÐµÐ±Ð¸Ð½Ð°Ñ€Ð½Ñ‹Ð¹ is for sure non-binary

Yeah, both Portuguese and Russian have the grammatical gender, except for several words such as eu, vocÃª. And even with those words, Russian requires the grammatical agreement:
Ð¯ Ñ€Ð°Ð±Ð¾Ñ‚Ð°Ð» - I worked (masculine)
Ð¯ Ñ€Ð°Ð±Ð¾Ñ‚Ð°Ð»Ð° - I worked (feminine)

In contrast, Japanese has no grammatical gender at all, but instead it has lexical means for gender, such as "ore" vs "atashi".

Thank you!

Unfortunately, isn't working:
```
$ axel -n 1 -a 'https://ipfs.io/ipfs/QmTtQppoBjBZRWaQ2dU2oG2chedMBWELataeuvP6YxZwLF?filename=brdoom.mp4'
Initializing download: https://ipfs.io/ipfs/QmTtQppoBjBZRWaQ2dU2oG2chedMBWELataeuvP6YxZwLF?filename=brdoom.mp4
File size: 114224200 bytes
Opening output file QmTtQppoBjBZRWaQ2dU2oG2chedMBWELataeuvP6YxZwLF
State file found: 2621440 bytes downloaded, 111602760 to go.
Starting download

Connection gone.
Status: 141[PIPE]
```
I've sent the reply at ZeroMail.

> Zerohello should really have notifications. I think it does not have them, at least.

One can see notifications from ZeroMe, but not from ZeroMail. That is by design. For ZeroNet engine, it's not possible to decrypt and read any letters at ZeroMail. Only ZeroMail application itself can do that, when you open it in your browser.

> Some people complained with me that putting a bunch of embedded videos in a single page causes a high usage of resources, so i might look into a way of making them not load automatically.

I did that intentionally, to improve the availability of the files. A browser starts caching/preloading of videos on the page load. Maybe that's not a fair play, but it worked. However, I can confirm, there are some troubles related to high resource usage.

Possible solutions:

1. Manual: Reduce the number of posts per page and don't embed too many videos in each post (hide additional videos under the "read more" section of the post)
2. Automatic: implement some settings for fine tuning the behaviour.

I guess the following options:

1. Don't preload any videos at all.
2. Preload only videos, that are in the visible part of the page.
3. Preload videos, that are in the visible part of the page, + several more randomly (to provide a kind of distributed cache among peers).
4. Preload all the videos on the page.

I'm going to implement those... someday.

Lately I was busy working on ZT++. The ZT++ sources seem now to be in a relatively good condition, so I probably should pay attention to ZB++ as well.

@Aassddff:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=blPFDWEMRDU

> What is the guy in the video saying (apart from dendy)?

I'm too lazy translate all the lyrics. The chorus is:
```
What is Dendy?
What is Dendy, that kids love so much?
Ooooooh, Dendy.
Ooooooh, Dendy.
It's an electronic game.
Ooooooh, Dendy.
Ooooooh, Dendy.
It's an electronic game, that kids love so much.
```
Just noticed, he said something like "den-ghee" instead of "den-dee" a couple of times in the very beginning.
Not sure how can a native speaker make such a mistake. "Den-ghee" (Ð´ÐµÐ½ÑŒÐ³Ð¸) means "money" in Russian. For me, it sound almost the same as "Dengue" in your video from Brasil.
Thank god many dangerous infections cannot be passed from person to person, otherwise humanity would die out.

This is not something carved in stone.
We can extend content.json with new metadata to achieve the interoperability with Freenet.
